net.tasmod.virtual

Class VirtualMouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tasmod.virtual.VirtualMouse

  • public class VirtualMouse
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an interface of the Mouse Class. This File records or manipulates these Calls

    • Field Detail

      • mouseEventsForTick

        public static final java.util.Queue<VirtualMouse.VirtualMouseEvent> mouseEventsForTick
        General Idea: LWJGL uses Events, these Events contain a bit of Information VirtualMouse.VirtualMouseEvent. You go trough them by running next() and then you access their Information using getEvent****. So every time next() is called, a new VirtualMouseEvent is being created, that is slowly being filled with data, by Minecraft Code that is accessing them. So if the MC Code asks for the Mouse Button, then our Code puts that Information into the VirtualMouseEvent. Replaying works the same, but instead of listening, it hacks the LWJGL Mouse like a Man In The Middle

      • getX

        public static final int getX()
        This Method is being called at only one point, that one being EntityRenderer, which is frame based. To make it be tick based, we replace this value with one, that is based on Ticks

      • getDX

        public static final int getDX()
        To make the Interpolation work, we are not asking LWJGL, but a Custom Util, that adds all the LWJGL Calls per Tick. Does not change anything with the Mouse

      • getDY

        public static final int getDY()
        To make the Interpolation work, we are not asking LWJGL, but a Custom Util, that adds all the LWJGL Calls per Tick. Does not change anything with the Mouse

      • isButtonDown

        public static final boolean isButtonDown(int i)
        isButtonDown does not use the Packets, instead it looks through all passed Packets (aka. see if the button is actually down on the Mouse) Update: ._. This is frame based and messes up Mouse Inputs entirely. Solution: Yeet this, and do a lazy play in next(). Problem with that is, that officially left and right clicking in all Slot Menus (Singleplayer, Stats, Texture Pack, etc) is working a bit less. public final static boolean isButtonDown(final int i) { if (!hack) { boolean val = Mouse.isButtonDown(i); if (listen) { currentlyListening.eventButton = i; currentlyListening.eventState = val; } return val; } for (final VirtualMouseEvent virtualMouseEvent : mouseEventsForTick) if (virtualMouseEvent.eventState == true && virtualMouseEvent.eventButton == i) return true; return false; }
